snippet: An imam was charged with inciting emotions to such a point that a 15-year-old who had misunderstood a question about the Prophet Muhammad cut off his own hand.

byline.original: By WAQAR GILLANI and ROD NORDLAND
byline.contributor: Waqar Gillani reported from Lahore, and Rod Nordland from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: An imam was charged with inciting emotions to such a point that a 15-year-old who had misunderstood a question about the Prophet Muhammad cut off his own hand.
abstract: Pakistanis are divided over case of imam Shabir Ahmad, whose public shaming of boy in mistaken case of blasphemy resulted in boy severing his own hand; authorities arrest and hold cleric on charges of inciting terrorism, while boy and his family approve of his actions; country's controversial blasphemy laws provoke extreme reactions.

headline.print_headline: Imam’s Arrest in False Case of Blasphemy Roils Pakistan
headline.main: Boy’s Response to Blasphemy Charge Unnerves Many in Pakistan
